name: NumericSummary
desc: A summary of a numerical column.

items.name: static func == (NumericSummary<Element>, NumericSummary<Element>) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates an empty numeric summary with default values.

items.name: init(someCount: Int, noneCount: Int, mean: Element, standardDeviation: Element, min: Element, max: Element, median: Element, firstQuartile: Element, thirdQuartile: Element)
var debugDescription: String
items.desc: A text representation of the summary’s statistics suitable for debugging.

items.name: var firstQuartile: Element
items.desc: The value that’s above 25% of the non-missing elements’ values.

items.name: var max: Element
items.desc: The largest value, excluding missing elements.

items.name: var mean: Element
items.desc: The arithmetic mean of a column’s values that excludes missing elements.

items.name: var median: Element
items.desc: The midpoint value that’s above half of the non-missing elements’ values and below the other half’s values.

items.name: var min: Element
items.desc: The smallest value, excluding missing elements.

items.name: var noneCount: Int
items.desc: The number of missing elements in the column.

items.name: var someCount: Int
items.desc: The number of non-missing elements in the column.

items.name: var standardDeviation: Element
items.desc: The standard deviation of a column’s values that excludes missing elements.

items.name: var thirdQuartile: Element
items.desc: The value that’s above 75% of the non-missing elements’ values.

items.name: var totalCount: Int
items.desc: The total number of elements in the column.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.
